newsitem.title: UK: EMS/Mark just below one-month peaks vs lira.
newsitem.headline: EMS/Mark just below one-month peaks vs lira.

text.p: 1005 GMT - Mark firm, just off sets one-month peak vs lira and at upper end of ranges vs other European crosses. Traders wary of central banks stepping in to halt weakening of their currencies. No signs of intervention cited so far.
* Mark/lira just off peaks of 995.25, highest since April 25. Last at 994.55/4.85 vs 991.90/2.20 yesterday. Traders say Bank of Italy checking prices.
* Italian bonds fall, 10-year BTP spread vs benchmark bund widens to 151 bp from 143 bp at open.
* Traders cite rumours of Italian rating downgrade. Moody's, IBCA decline comment on Italy's ratings, S&P says Italy not on CreditWatch.

* Italian GDP fell 0.3 percent q/q in first quarter 1997. Weaker-than-expected growth seen making it harder for Italy to meet EMU fiscal criteria. Cabinet to discuss three-year economic plan, the DPEF.
* Spanish official says Italy unlikely to join EMU from outset.

* Mark/Swiss falls amid flight to safe haven, last at 83.00/02 centimes vs 83.25/28 yesterday. Mark/Paris at 3.3791/96 vs 3.3804/09. Traders sensitive to rumours of private polls before second round of French elections Sunday.
* Buba's Welteke says Bonn can avoid dispute with central bank by dropping plan to revalue assets.
